headline.main: Scientists Say Cigarette Company Suppressed Findings on Nicotine

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists at the Philip Morris Company found evidence 11 years ago that a substance in cigarettes was as addictive as nicotine, and that the two combined far exceeded the addictive power of either, two scientists testified at a Congressional hearing today. But the research was halted by the tobacco company, and efforts to publish that and other work were blocked, the researchers said.
